name.description: Name of Stardog instace as seen in DCOS.

cpus.description: Number of logical cores to allocate to each service instance.

mem.description: Memory in Mb to allocate to each service instance.

instances.description: Number of instances of your service.

artifact_URI.description: If your service requires additional files and/or archives of files, enter their URIs to download and, if necessary, extract these resources.

placement.description: Constraints control where apps run to allow optimizing for either fault tolerance (by spreading a task out on multiple nodes) or locality (by running all of an applications tasks on the same node).

constraints.description: Constraints have three parts: a field name, an operator, and an optional parameter. The field can be the hostname of the agent node or any attribute of the agent node. Example: [["rack_id", "LIKE", "rack-foo-.*"], ["rack_id", "MAX_PER", "2"]]

networking.description: Configure the networking for your service.

external_access.description:
Enable access from outside the cluster through Marathon-LB.
NOTE: this connection is unencrypted.

enabled.description: Enable or disable external access through a public node via Marathon-LB.

external_public_agent_hostname.description: For external access, Virtual Host URL to be used in the external load balancer.

volumes.description: Storage properties for the your service on DC/OS.

persist.description: Whether to use volumes to persist your service data, aka 'you want a volume or not'. If false, all your service data and state is ephemeral and will not be shared between service instances. By default, this is false.

local_volume.description: Local volumes configuration (only used if external persistent volumes are disabled). Please read Pre-Install Notes for setup for local volumes.

host_path.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting your service configuration and data.

container_path.description: The location of a volume on the host to be used for persisting your service configuration and data.

external_volume.description: External volumes configuration. Uses the REX-Ray volume driver.

enable.description: Whether to use DC/OS external volumes to persist your service data. By default, this is false.

container_path.description: The path where the volume is mounted inside the container. For Mesos external volumes, this must be a single-level path relative to the container; it cannot contain a forward slash (/).

name.description: The name that your volume driver uses to look up your volume. When your task is staged on an agent, the volume driver queries the storage service for a volume with this name. If one does not exist, it is created implicitly. Otherwise, the existing volume is reused.

options.description: Which Docker volume driver to use for storage. The only Docker volume driver provided with DC/OS is rexray

environment.description: Configure any environment values to be attached to each instance that is launched.
